channel.title: Dedication to Memorial day
channel.description:
If theres anyone out there whos family is fighting the the war right now or just thankful of the people in the war.. read this..on 9/11 terroists attacked the would trade senter.. the attack the whole world knows about.. after that dreadful day, many lost there lives trying to save other peoples lives, and for the many who didnt make it.. there body may never be found.. after the attack was over people voulintered to clean up the rubbage which took weeks.. after that attack we started war with irac.. which is now spreading to afganstand.. and all ready tens of thousands of our soldiers died.. and this is what this day is for.. dedication the people who are fighing in the war, so please show all your respect and repost with comments...
please go to my myspace and watch some of the videos.. there sure to make you respect our country.
[url=http://myspace.com/mitchel9351]myspace.com/mitchel9351[/url]
will be adding more later..

item.title: Dedication to Memorial day
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“pk4pk, post:29, topic:208302”]If we pull off now thousands of men will die trying to get back. Unless we have men defending the men who are coming back it will be like the war is still continuing because then those men will need other men to protect them. They also will have an advantage over aircrafts because of the amounts of rpg’s that Iraq has. We have to beat them to get out is what I think, and so far we are losing. They have killed more but the numbers that we are facing is incrediblely small. We have hundreds of thousands of troops in Iraq and they have thousands. Almost 4,000 have died and many more have been wouned, or mentally fucked. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2008, 01:57:50 PM[/size][hr][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=274570.msg2245612#msg2245612 date=1211924422]
I’d rather have Bush then Obama with his ‘time for change’. Mark my words, Obama will ruin the country even more.
[/quote]Hilliory ftw. [I do like Hilliory because she has an experienced president for a husband ;)][/quote]

Why try?

Read full topic

item.title: Dedication to Memorial day
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:20, topic:208302”][quote author=goatee link=topic=274570.msg2245369#msg2245369 date=1211907904]

Oh c’mon?
[/quote]

If Bush had never been in office, the U.S. wouldn’t be having all the problems it has now.
When we had a democrat in office, we had a surplus in our treasury, gas was about $1.43 a gallon, and the rest of the world didn’t hate us.

All this war crap is stupid. The only reason we should’ve been in the Middle East was to go after Bin Laden, which we did for a good year. But then Bush happened to notice Iraq, and all of it’s oil, and then uses the excuse of taking out Saddam Hussein and installing a democratic system of government in a region of the world that’s been fighting amongst itself since the beginning of history.[/quote]

It has also really fucked up the UKs petrol prices… it’s a fucking rip off here, goes up by so much everyday. Your petrol is cheap compared to ours. America was so greedy that it wanted more oil even though it had loads itself (Texas biatch).
[/quote]

Exactly. We had no reason to be over there in the first place. The U.S. really screwed EVERYBODY over by going into Iraq. The country is so messed up. More people vote for the contestants of fucking American Idol than the number of people that participate in the presidential elections. And that’s simply cause a lot of people in this country don’t give a rats’ ass about what is going on. Aside from the actual intelligent people that occupy it, the U.S. is a nation of idiots.

Go Obama =D
[/quote]
You should not only blame Bush for the Iraq war, there was done lots of wrong things.
And $1.43 is really cheap compared to Norwegian prices, 2.6 $ for one liter, (9,841$ for one gallon) so much is the price in US now?

I think even have Saddam Hussein as a leader had been better than the Americans attack Iraq, then they at least have a leader.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedication to Memorial day
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“I Br3ndan I, post:18, topic:208302”]Who knows why Bush is really in there? We’ll probably never know. That’s the most extreme form of secret information. War is crap, you’re right. But we’re animals, and we haven’t quite reached the level of intelligence where we have realised war breeds hate which breeds more war, so we stop initiating it. There are a lot of people who acknowledge war is bad, but are careless because of the rewards they reap from it.

It’s a really deep discussion (Disregard politics, it has nothing to do with war, it’s all about morals and standards, and the human mind), and it’s one that will become deeper and deeper as time goes on and more wars are waged. Brain hurts[/quote]

Bush is there for the oil, he just too stupid to admit it.

Did anyone happen to see that rant on CNN about Bush? i don’t remember the speaker’s name, but it was a really good fifteen minutes of criticism.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2008, 06:12:59 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Niall, post:21, topic:208302”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=274570.msg2245367#msg2245367 date=1211907707]and the rest of the world didn’t hate us.[/quote]

Oh?[/quote]

Well, not as much.
=D

“Original post here” edited to save space

Please, before you start preaching this shit at least do some research. If you count the amount of civilians killed in 9/11 and then the amount killed in the war in iraq, you would think a whole lot differently.

item.title: Dedication to Memorial day
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Who knows why Bush is really in there? We’ll probably never know. That’s the most extreme form of secret information. War is crap, you’re right. But we’re animals, and we haven’t quite reached the level of intelligence where we have realised war breeds hate which breeds more war, so we stop initiating it. There are a lot of people who acknowledge war is bad, but are careless because of the rewards they reap from it.

It’s a really deep discussion (Disregard politics, it has nothing to do with war, it’s all about morals and standards, and the human mind), and it’s one that will become deeper and deeper as time goes on and more wars are waged. Brain hurts

item.title: Dedication to Memorial day
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“Secet, post:8, topic:208302”]Actually USA went to Afghanistan first at 2001 because of the 9/11.
They went to Iraq in 2003 because they thought Saddam Hussein had chemical weapons. But guess what, none were found. I’m not saying that Saddam was a good leader but I think things are even worse now, americans have been there for 5 years now.

So please get your facts right, you seem to respect your troopers even tho you don’t even know where they are or why they are there.

I cannot respect country that goes to war on other continent with some fake excuse. If they had spent that money on education, maybe you could type with computer and learn something new.
I give all my respect to members of resistance movement who defend their fatherland, even if it costs their lives.

Many people think that war in Iraq is over, but it’s not. You never won it, and more and more soldiers will die every day until you leave Iraq.[/quote]

Our dear President Bush is a war criminal, he went to Iraq with hopes on capitalizing on all the oil there, but now look what’s happened. People in other countries outside of the U.S. resent us because we started all this Iraq war bullshit. In reality, it was our president’s decision, which he’s most likely going to get away with once he finally is kicked out of office in '09.

Al Gore rightfullly won the presidential election back in 2000, but got eternally screwed over by the Bush family. None of this war crap would’ve happened in the first place. If 9/11 did happen if Gore was in office, we’d only be in Afghanistan searching for Bin Laden, not trying to impose a different way of life on people like we are now doing in Iraq.

Read full topic
